security: Revealing the identification of a Cuban CI officer who played a 'significant role' in the Cuban Missile Crisis conferences and the potential identification of a 'Cuban active measures asset' as the author of the article, could jeopardize ongoing or future intelligence operations and compromise the safety of individuals involved.
summary: A CIA message reports a possible Cuban active measures campaign to promote the idea of CIA involvement in the JFK assassination, following a conference attended by a Cuban CI officer and US citizen 'investigators'. It requests the text and author of an article, suspecting the author may be a Cuban asset.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET CIA message, dated September 5, 1995, addresses a potential Cuban active measures campaign aimed at promoting the theory of CIA involvement in the JFK assassination. Triggered by a referenced article (LIMA 36844), the message indicates that a conference, attended by Cuban CI officer Escalante and others significant in the Cuban Missile Crisis conferences of 1992-93, also included US citizen 'investigators' promoting conjectures about the CIA's role in Kennedy's assassination. The CIA requests the article text and author's byline to assess whether the author is a Cuban asset, adding Havana to the distribution list for related communications.
title: Cuban 'Affirmation' of CIA Plot Against JFK
conspiracy: This message references Cuban 'affirmation' of CIA involvement in the JFK assassination, so it seems to lend credence to the conspiracy that the CIA had something to do with it.
